properties.areaDesc: Charleston Harbor; Coastal waters from Edisto Beach SC to Savannah GA out 20 nm; Coastal waters from South Santee River to Edisto Beach SC out 20 nm
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 11 at 7:09PM EST by NWS Charleston SC
properties.description:
Satellite and pilot boat observations suggest an area of sea fog
is trying to develop off the lower South Carolina coast this
evening, mainly from Port Royal Sound to Bulls Bay and extending
offshore 15 NM. This includes the entrance to Charleston Harbor.

Any sea fog that forms has the potential to become dense with
visibility dropping to 1 NM or less. This fog is expected to move
off the northeast through 10 PM, however conditions will remain
favorable for more sea fog to form early Wednesday morning.
Mariners should remain alert for rapidly changing conditions.
properties.instruction:
Mariners are urged to navigate with extreme care. If you must
navigate in these conditions, proceed with caution. Use proper
fog signals, including fog horns. Make sure all navigational
running lights are on.

Please relay any reports of sea fog to the Charleston or Tybee
Island Coast Guard stations and ask them to immediately forward
your report to the National Weather Service in Charleston.

NWSheadline: AREAS OF SEA FOG POSSIBLE OFF THE LOWER SOUTH CAROLINA COAST THIS EVENING
